013package org.apache.juneau.rest.client;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.IOUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
018
019import java.io.*;
020import java.lang.reflect.*;
021import java.nio.charset.*;
022import java.util.concurrent.*;
023import java.util.regex.*;
024import java.util.regex.Matcher;
025
026import org.apache.http.*;
027import org.apache.http.conn.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.assertions.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.http.entity.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.http.resource.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.oapi.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
038import org.apache.juneau.parser.ParseException;
039import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
040import org.apache.juneau.rest.client.assertion.*;
041
042/**
043 * Represents the body of an HTTP response.
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * An extension of an HttpClient {@link HttpEntity} that provides various support for converting the body to POJOs and
047 * other convenience methods.
048 *
049 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
050 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#juneau-rest-client">juneau-rest-client</a>
051 * </ul>
052 */
053public class ResponseContent implements HttpEntity {
054
055   private static final HttpEntity NULL_ENTITY = new HttpEntity() {
056
057      @Override
058      public boolean isRepeatable() {
059         return false;
060      }
061
062      @Override
063      public boolean isChunked() {
064         return false;
065      }
066
067      @Override
068      public long getContentLength() {
069         return -1;
070      }
071
072      @Override
073      public Header getContentType() {
074         return ResponseHeader.NULL_HEADER;
075      }
076
077      @Override
078      public Header getContentEncoding() {
079         return ResponseHeader.NULL_HEADER;
080      }
081
082      @Override
083      public InputStream getContent() throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
084         return new ByteArrayInputStream(new byte[0]);
085      }
086
087      @Override
088      public void writeTo(OutputStream outstream) throws IOException {}
089
090      @Override
091      public boolean isStreaming() {
092         return false;
093      }
094
095      @Override
096      public void consumeContent() throws IOException {}
097   };
098
099   private final RestClient client;
100   final RestRequest request;
101   final RestResponse response;
102   private final HttpEntity entity;
103   private HttpPartSchema schema;
104   private Parser parser;
105   private byte[] body;
106   private boolean cached;
107   boolean isConsumed;
108
109   /**
110    * Constructor.
111    *
112    * @param client The client used to build this request.
113    * @param request The request object.
114    * @param response The response object.
115    * @param parser The parser to use to consume the body.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
116    */
117   public ResponseContent(RestClient client, RestRequest request, RestResponse response, Parser parser) {
118      this.client = client;
119      this.request = request;
120      this.response = response;
121      this.parser = parser;
122      this.entity = Utils.firstNonNull(response.asHttpResponse().getEntity(), NULL_ENTITY);
123   }
124
125   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
126   // Setters
127   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
128
129   /**
130    * Specifies the parser to use for this body.
131    *
132    * <p>
133    * If not specified, uses the parser defined on the client set via {@link RestClient.Builder#parser(Class)}.
134    *
135    * @param value
136    *    The new part parser to use for this body.
137    * @return This object.
138    */
139   public ResponseContent parser(Parser value) {
140      this.parser = value;
141      return this;
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * Specifies the schema for this body.
146    *
147    * <p>
148    * Used by schema-based parsers such as {@link OpenApiParser}.
149    *
150    * @param value The schema.
151    * @return This object.
152    */
153   public ResponseContent schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
154      this.schema = value;
155      return this;
156   }
157
158   /**
159    * Causes the contents of the response body to be stored so that it can be repeatedly read.
160    *
161    * <p>
162    * Calling this method allows methods that read the response body to be called multiple times.
163    *
164    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
165    *    <li class='note'>
166    *       Multiple calls to this method are ignored.
167    * </ul>
168    *
169    * @return This object.
170    */
171   public ResponseContent cache() {
172      this.cached = true;
173      return this;
174   }
175
176   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
177   // Raw streams
178   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
179
180   /**
181    * Returns the HTTP response message body as an input stream.
182    *
183    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
184    *    <li class='note'>
185    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
186    *  <li class='note'>
187    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
188    *  <li class='note'>
189    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
190    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
191    * </ul>
192    *
193    * @return
194    *    The HTTP response message body input stream, never <jk>null</jk>.
195    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty stream.
196    * @throws IOException If a stream or illegal state exception was thrown.
197    */
198   @SuppressWarnings("resource")
199   public InputStream asInputStream() throws IOException {
200      try {
201         if (body != null)
202            return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
203
204         if (cached) {
205            body = readBytes(entity.getContent());
206            response.close();
207            return new ByteArrayInputStream(body);
208         }
209
210         if (isConsumed && ! entity.isRepeatable())
211            throw new IllegalStateException("Method cannot be called.  Response has already been consumed.  Consider using the RestResponse.cacheBody() method.");
212
213         HttpEntity e = response.asHttpResponse().getEntity();
214         InputStream is = e == null ? new ByteArrayInputStream(new byte[0]) : e.getContent();
215
216         is = new EofSensorInputStream(is, new EofSensorWatcher() {
217            @Override
218            public boolean eofDetected(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
219               try {
220                  response.close();
221               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
222               return true;
223            }
224            @Override
225            public boolean streamClosed(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
226               try {
227                  response.close();
228               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
229               return true;
230            }
231            @Override
232            public boolean streamAbort(InputStream wrapped) throws IOException {
233               try {
234                  response.close();
235               } catch (RestCallException e) {}
236               return true;
237            }
238         });
239
240         isConsumed = true;
241
242         return is;
243      } catch (UnsupportedOperationException | RestCallException e) {
244         throw new IOException(e);
245      }
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a reader based on the charset on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header.
250    *
251    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
252    *    <li class='note'>
253    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
254    *    <li class='note'>
255    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
256    *  <li class='note'>
257    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
258    *  <li class='note'>
259    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
260    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
261    * </ul>
262    *
263    * @return
264    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
265    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty reader.
266    * @throws IOException If an exception occurred.
267    */
268   public Reader asReader() throws IOException {
269
270      // Figure out what the charset of the response is.
271      String cs = null;
272      String ct = getContentType().orElse(null);
273
274      // First look for "charset=" in Content-Type header of response.
275      if (ct != null)
276         if (ct.contains("charset="))
277            cs = ct.substring(ct.indexOf("charset=")+8).trim();
278
279      return asReader(cs == null ? IOUtils.UTF8 : Charset.forName(cs));
280   }
281
282   /**
283    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a reader using the specified charset.
284    *
285    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
286    *    <li class='note'>
287    *       Once this input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
288    *  <li class='note'>
289    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
290    *  <li class='note'>
291    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
292    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
293    * </ul>
294    *
295    * @param charset
296    *    The charset to use for the reader.
297    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
298    * @return
299    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
300    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty reader.
301    * @throws IOException If an exception occurred.
302    */
303   public Reader asReader(Charset charset) throws IOException {
304      return new InputStreamReader(asInputStream(), charset == null ? IOUtils.UTF8 : charset);
305   }
306
307   /**
308    * Returns the HTTP response message body as a byte array.
309    *
310    *    The HTTP response message body reader, never <jk>null</jk>.
311    *    <br>For responses without a body(e.g. HTTP 204), returns an empty array.
312    *
313    * @return The HTTP response body as a byte array.
314    * @throws RestCallException If an exception occurred.
315    */
316   public byte[] asBytes() throws RestCallException {
317      if (body == null) {
318         try {
319            if (entity instanceof BasicHttpEntity) {
320               body = ((BasicHttpEntity)entity).asBytes();
321            } else {
322               body = readBytes(entity.getContent());
323            }
324         } catch (IOException e) {
325            throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not read response body.");
326         } finally {
327            response.close();
328         }
329      }
330      return body;
331   }
332
333
334   /**
335    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified output stream.
336    *
337    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
338    * <li class='note'>
339    *    The output stream is not automatically closed.
340    *    <li class='note'>
341    *       Once the input stream is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
342    *  <li class='note'>
343    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
344    *  <li class='note'>
345    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
346    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
347    * </ul>
348    *
349    * @param os The output stream to pipe the output to.
350    * @return This object.
351    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
352    */
353   public RestResponse pipeTo(OutputStream os) throws IOException {
354      pipe(asInputStream(), os);
355      return response;
356   }
357
358   /**
359    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
360    *
361    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
362    * <li class='note'>
363    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
364    *    <li class='note'>
365    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
366    *    <li class='note'>
367    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
368    *  <li class='note'>
369    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
370    *  <li class='note'>
371    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
372    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
373    * </ul>
374    *
375    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
376    * @return This object.
377    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
378    */
379   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w) throws IOException {
380      return pipeTo(w, false);
381   }
382
383   /**
384    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
385    *
386    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
387    * <li class='note'>
388    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
389    *    <li class='note'>
390    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
391    *  <li class='note'>
392    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
393    *  <li class='note'>
394    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
395    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
396    * </ul>
397    *
398    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
399    * @param charset
400    *    The charset to use for the reader.
401    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
402    * @return This object.
403    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
404    */
405   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, Charset charset) throws IOException {
406      return pipeTo(w, charset, false);
407   }
408
409   /**
410    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
411    *
412    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
413    * <li class='note'>
414    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
415    *    <li class='note'>
416    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
417    *    <li class='note'>
418    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
419    *  <li class='note'>
420    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
421    *  <li class='note'>
422    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
423    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
424    * </ul>
425    *
426    * @param w The writer to write the output to.
427    * @param byLines Flush the writers after every line of output.
428    * @return This object.
429    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
430    */
431   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, boolean byLines) throws IOException {
432      return pipeTo(w, null, byLines);
433   }
434
435   /**
436    * Pipes the contents of the response to the specified writer.
437    *
438    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
439    * <li class='note'>
440    *    The writer is not automatically closed.
441    *    <li class='note'>
442    *       Once the reader is exhausted, it will automatically be closed.
443    *  <li class='note'>
444    *    This method can be called multiple times if {@link #cache()} has been called.
445    *  <li class='note'>
446    *    Calling this method multiple times without caching enabled will cause a {@link RestCallException}
447    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} to be thrown.
448    * </ul>
449    *
450    * @param w The writer to pipe the output to.
451    * @param byLines Flush the writers after every line of output.
452    * @param charset
453    *    The charset to use for the reader.
454    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is used.
455    * @return This object.
456    * @throws IOException If an IO exception occurred.
457    */
458   public RestResponse pipeTo(Writer w, Charset charset, boolean byLines) throws IOException {
459      if (byLines)
460         pipeLines(asReader(charset), w);
461      else
462         pipe(asReader(charset), w);
463      return response;
464   }
465
466   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
467   // Retrievers
468   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
469
470   /**
471    * Parses HTTP body into the specified object type.
472    *
473    * <p>
474    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
475    *
476    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
477    * <p class='bjava'>
478    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
479    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
480    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
481    *       .run()
482    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
483    *
484    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
485    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
486    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
487    *       .run()
488    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
489    *
490    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
491    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
492    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
493    *       .run()
494    *       .getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
495    *
496    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
497    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
498    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
499    *       .run()
500    *       .getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
501    *
502    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
503    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
504    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
505    *       .run()
506    *       .getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
507    * </p>
508    *
509    * <p>
510    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
511    *
512    * <p>
513    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
514    *
515    * <p>
516    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
517    *
518    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
519    *    <li class='note'>
520    *       Use the {@link #as(Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
521    *    <li class='note'>
522    *       You can also specify any of the following types:
523    *       <ul class='compact'>
524    *          <li>{@link ResponseContent}/{@link HttpEntity} - Returns access to this object.
525    *          <li>{@link Reader} - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
526    *          <li>{@link InputStream} - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
527    *          <li>{@link HttpResource} - Response will be converted to an {@link BasicResource}.
528    *          <li>Any type that takes in an {@link HttpResponse} object.
529    *       </ul>
530    *    <li class='note'>
531    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
532    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
533    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
534    *    <li class='note'>
535    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
536    * </ul>
537    *
538    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
539    * @param type
540    *    The object type to create.
541    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
542    * @param args
543    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
544    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
545    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
546    * @return The parsed object.
547    * @throws RestCallException
548    *    <ul>
549    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
550    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
551    *    </ul>
552    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Class) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
553    */
554   public <T> T as(Type type, Type...args) throws RestCallException {
555      return as(getClassMeta(type, args));
556   }
557
558   /**
559    * Same as {@link #as(Type,Type...)} except optimized for a non-parameterized class.
560    *
561    * <p>
562    * This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.
563    *
564    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
565    * <p class='bjava'>
566    *    <jc>// Parse into a string.</jc>
567    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(String.<jk>class</jk>);
568    *
569    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean.</jc>
570    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
571    *
572    *    <jc>// Parse into a bean array.</jc>
573    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
574    *
575    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of objects.</jc>
576    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
577    *
578    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of object keys/values.</jc>
579    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
580    * </p>
581    *
582    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
583    *    <li class='note'>
584    *       You can also specify any of the following types:
585    *       <ul class='compact'>
586    *          <li>{@link ResponseContent}/{@link HttpEntity} - Returns access to this object.
587    *          <li>{@link Reader} - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
588    *          <li>{@link InputStream} - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
589    *          <li>{@link HttpResource} - Response will be converted to an {@link BasicResource}.
590    *          <li>Any type that takes in an {@link HttpResponse} object.
591    *       </ul>
592    *    <li class='note'>
593    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
594    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
595    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
596    *    <li class='note'>
597    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
598    * </ul>
599    *
600    * @param <T>
601    *    The class type of the object being created.
602    *    See {@link #as(Type,Type...)} for details.
603    * @param type The object type to create.
604    * @return The parsed object.
605    * @throws RestCallException
606    *    If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type, or if a connection
607    *    error occurred.
608    */
609   public <T> T as(Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
610      return as(getClassMeta(type));
611   }
612
613   /**
614    * Same as {@link #as(Class)} except allows you to predefine complex data types using the {@link ClassMeta} API.
615    *
616    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
617    * <p class='bjava'>
618    *    BeanContext <jv>beanContext</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
619    *
620    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of strings.</jc>
621    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm1</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
622    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm1</jv>);
623    *
624    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of beans.</jc>
625    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm2</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
626    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm2</jv>);
627    *
628    *    <jc>// Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
629    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm3</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
630    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm3</jv>);
631    *
632    *    <jc>// Parse into a map of string keys/values.</jc>
633    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm4</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
634    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map4</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm4</jv>);
635    *
636    *    <jc>// Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
637    * ClassMeta&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>cm5</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.getClassMeta(TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
638    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map5</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).run().getContent().as(<jv>cm5</jv>);
639    * </p>
640    *
641    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
642    *    <li class='note'>
643    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
644    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
645    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
646    *    <li class='note'>
647    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
648    * </ul>
649    *
650    * @param <T> The class type of the object to create.
651    * @param type The object type to create.
652    * @return The parsed object.
653    * @throws RestCallException
654    *    <ul>
655    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
656    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
657    *    </ul>
658    * @see BeanSession#getClassMeta(Class) for argument syntax for maps and collections.
659    */
660   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
661   public <T> T as(ClassMeta<T> type) throws RestCallException {
662      try {
663         if (type.is(ResponseContent.class) || type.is(HttpEntity.class))
664            return (T)this;
665
666         if (type.is(Reader.class))
667            return (T)asReader();
668
669         if (type.is(InputStream.class))
670            return (T)asInputStream();
671
672         if (type.is(HttpResponse.class))
673            return (T)response;
674
675         if (type.is(HttpResource.class))
676            type = (ClassMeta<T>)getClassMeta(BasicResource.class);
677
678         ConstructorInfo ci = type.getInfo().getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(HttpResponse.class));
679         if (ci != null) {
680            try {
681               return (T)ci.invoke(response);
682            } catch (ExecutableException e) {
683               throw asRuntimeException(e);
684            }
685         }
686
687         String ct = firstNonEmpty(response.getHeader("Content-Type").orElse("text/plain"));
688
689         if (parser == null)
690            parser = client.getMatchingParser(ct);
691
692         MediaType mt = MediaType.of(ct);
693
694         if (parser == null || (mt.toString().contains("text/plain") && ! parser.canHandle(ct))) {
695            if (type.hasStringMutater())
696               return type.getStringMutater().mutate(asString());
697         }
698
699         if (parser != null) {
700            try (Closeable in = parser.isReaderParser() ? asReader() : asInputStream()) {
701
702               T t = parser
703                  .createSession()
704                  .properties(JsonMap.create().inner(request.getSessionProperties()))
705                  .locale(response.getLocale())
706                  .mediaType(mt)
707                  .schema(schema)
708                  .build()
709                  .parse(in, type);
710
711               // Some HTTP responses have no body, so try to create these beans if they've got no-arg constructors.
712               if (t == null && ! type.is(String.class)) {
713                  ConstructorInfo c = type.getInfo().getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
714                  if (c != null) {
715                     try {
716                        return c.<T>invoke();
717                     } catch (ExecutableException e) {
718                        throw new ParseException(e);
719                     }
720                  }
721               }
722
723               return t;
724            }
725         }
726
727         if (type.hasReaderMutater())
728            return type.getReaderMutater().mutate(asReader());
729
730         if (type.hasInputStreamMutater())
731            return type.getInputStreamMutater().mutate(asInputStream());
732
733         ct = response.getStringHeader("Content-Type").orElse(null);
734
735         if (ct == null && client.hasParsers())
736            throw new ParseException("Content-Type not specified in response header.  Cannot find appropriate parser.");
737
738         throw new ParseException("Unsupported media-type in request header ''Content-Type'': ''{0}''", ct);
739
740      } catch (ParseException | IOException e) {
741         response.close();
742         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not parse response body.");
743      }
744   }
745
746   /**
747    * Same as {@link #as(Class)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
748    *
749    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
750    *    <li class='note'>
751    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
752    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
753    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
754    *    <li class='note'>
755    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
756    * </ul>
757    *
758    * @param <T> The class type of the object being created.
759    * @param type The object type to create.
760    * @return The future object.
761    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
762    * @see
763    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
764    *    {@link Future Futures}.
765    */
766    public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
767        return client.getExecutorService().submit(() -> as(type));
768    }
769
770   /**
771    * Same as {@link #as(ClassMeta)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
772    *
773    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
774    *    <li class='note'>
775    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
776    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
777    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
778    *    <li class='note'>
779    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
780    * </ul>
781    *
782    * @param <T>
783    *    The class type of the object being created.
784    *    See {@link #as(Type, Type...)} for details.
785    * @param type The object type to create.
786    * @return The future object.
787    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
788    * @see
789    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
790    *    {@link Future Futures}.
791    */
792    public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final ClassMeta<T> type) throws RestCallException {
793        return client.getExecutorService().submit(() -> as(type));
794    }
795
796   /**
797    * Same as {@link #as(Type,Type...)} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
798    *
799    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
800    *    <li class='note'>
801    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
802    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
803    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
804    *    <li class='note'>
805    *       The input stream is automatically closed after the execution of the future.
806    * </ul>
807    *
808    * @param <T>
809    *    The class type of the object being created.
810    *    See {@link #as(Type, Type...)} for details.
811    * @param type
812    *    The object type to create.
813    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
814    * @param args
815    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
816    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
817    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
818    * @return The future object.
819    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
820    * @see
821    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
822    *    {@link Future Futures}.
823    */
824    public <T> Future<T> asFuture(final Type type, final Type... args) throws RestCallException {
825        return client.getExecutorService().submit(() -> as(type, args));
826    }
827
828   /**
829    * Returns the contents of this body as a string.
830    *
831    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
832    *    <li class='note'>
833    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
834    *  <li class='note'>
835    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
836    *    <li class='note'>
837    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
838    * </ul>
839    *
840    * @return The response as a string.
841    * @throws RestCallException
842    *    <ul>
843    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
844    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
845    *    </ul>
846    */
847   public String asString() throws RestCallException {
848      cache();
849      try (Reader r = asReader()) {
850         return read(r);
851      } catch (IOException e) {
852         response.close();
853         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Could not read response body.");
854      }
855   }
856
857   /**
858    * Same as {@link #asString()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
859    *
860    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
861    *    <li class='note'>
862    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
863    *  <li class='note'>
864    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
865    *    <li class='note'>
866    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
867    * </ul>
868    *
869    * @return The future object.
870    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
871    * @see
872    *    RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean) for defining the executor service for creating
873    *    {@link Future Futures}.
874    */
875    public Future<String> asStringFuture() throws RestCallException {
876        return client.getExecutorService().submit(this::asString);
877    }
878
879   /**
880    * Same as {@link #asString()} but truncates the string to the specified length.
881    *
882    * <p>
883    * If truncation occurs, the string will be suffixed with <js>"..."</js>.
884    *
885    * @param length The max length of the returned string.
886    * @return The truncated string.
887    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
888    */
889   public String asAbbreviatedString(int length) throws RestCallException {
890      return StringUtils.abbreviate(asString(), length);
891   }
892
893   /**
894    * Returns the HTTP body content as a simple hexadecimal character string.
895    *
896    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
897    * <p class='bcode'>
898    *    0123456789ABCDEF
899    * </p>
900    *
901    * @return The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
902    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
903    */
904   public String asHex() throws RestCallException {
905      return toHex(asBytes());
906   }
907
908   /**
909    * Returns the HTTP body content as a simple space-delimited hexadecimal character string.
910    *
911    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
912    * <p class='bcode'>
913    *    01 23 45 67 89 AB CD EF
914    * </p>
915    *
916    * @return The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
917    * @throws RestCallException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
918    */
919   public String asSpacedHex() throws RestCallException {
920      return toSpacedHex(asBytes());
921   }
922
923   /**
924    * Parses the output from the body into the specified type and then wraps that in a {@link ObjectRest}.
925    *
926    * <p>
927    * Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.
928    *
929    * @param innerType The class type of the POJO being wrapped.
930    * @return The parsed output wrapped in a {@link ObjectRest}.
931    * @throws RestCallException
932    *    <ul>
933    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
934    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
935    *    </ul>
936    */
937   public ObjectRest asObjectRest(Class<?> innerType) throws RestCallException {
938      return new ObjectRest(as(innerType));
939   }
940
941   /**
942    * Converts the output from the connection into an {@link JsonMap} and then wraps that in a {@link ObjectRest}.
943    *
944    * <p>
945    * Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.
946    *
947    * @return The parsed output wrapped in a {@link ObjectRest}.
948    * @throws RestCallException
949    *    <ul>
950    *       <li>If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
951    *       <li>If a connection error occurred.
952    *    </ul>
953    */
954   public ObjectRest asObjectRest() throws RestCallException {
955      return asObjectRest(JsonMap.class);
956   }
957
958   /**
959    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
960    *
961    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
962    * <p class='bjava'>
963    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
964    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
965    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
966    *       .run()
967    *       .getContent().asMatcher(Pattern.<jsm>compile</jsm>(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>));
968    *
969    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
970    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
971    *    }
972    * </p>
973    *
974    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
975    *    <li class='note'>
976    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
977    *  <li class='note'>
978    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
979    *    <li class='note'>
980    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
981    * </ul>
982    *
983    * @param pattern The regular expression pattern to match.
984    * @return The matcher.
985    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
986    */
987   public Matcher asMatcher(Pattern pattern) throws RestCallException {
988      return pattern.matcher(asString());
989   }
990
991   /**
992    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
993    *
994    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
995    * <p class='bjava'>
996    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
997    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
998    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
999    *       .run()
1000    *       .getContent().asMatcher(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>);
1001    *
1002    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
1003    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
1004    *    }
1005    * </p>
1006    *
1007    *
1008    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1009    *    <li class='note'>
1010    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1011    *  <li class='note'>
1012    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
1013    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
1014    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
1015    *    <li class='note'>
1016    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1017    * </ul>
1018    *
1019    * @param regex The regular expression pattern to match.
1020    * @return The matcher.
1021    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1022    */
1023   public Matcher asMatcher(String regex) throws RestCallException {
1024      return asMatcher(regex, 0);
1025   }
1026
1027   /**
1028    * Converts the contents of the response body to a string and then matches the specified pattern against it.
1029    *
1030    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1031    * <p class='bjava'>
1032    *    <jc>// Parse response using a regular expression.</jc>
1033    *    Matcher <jv>matcher</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1034    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1035    *       .run()
1036    *       .getContent().asMatcher(<js>"foo=(.*)"</js>, <jsf>MULTILINE</jsf> &amp; <jsf>CASE_INSENSITIVE</jsf>);
1037    *
1038    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>matcher</jv>.matches()) {
1039    *       String <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>matcher</jv>.group(1);
1040    *    }
1041    * </p>
1042    *
1043    *
1044    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1045    *    <li class='note'>
1046    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1047    *  <li class='note'>
1048    *    If {@link #cache()} or {@link RestResponse#cacheContent()} has been called, this method can be can be called multiple times and/or combined with
1049    *    other methods that retrieve the content of the response.  Otherwise a {@link RestCallException}
1050    *    with an inner {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown.
1051    *    <li class='note'>
1052    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1053    * </ul>
1054    *
1055    * @param regex The regular expression pattern to match.
1056    * @param flags Pattern match flags.  See {@link Pattern#compile(String, int)}.
1057    * @return The matcher.
1058    * @throws RestCallException If a connection error occurred.
1059    */
1060   public Matcher asMatcher(String regex, int flags) throws RestCallException {
1061      return asMatcher(Pattern.compile(regex, flags));
1062   }
1063
1064   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1065   // Assertions
1066   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1067
1068   /**
1069    * Provides the ability to perform fluent-style assertions on this response body.
1070    *
1071    * <p>
1072    * This method is called directly from the {@link RestResponse#assertContent()} method to instantiate a fluent assertions object.
1073    *
1074    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1075    * <p class='bjava'>
1076    *    <jc>// Validates the response body equals the text "OK".</jc>
1077    *    <jv>client</jv>
1078    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1079    *       .run()
1080    *       .getContent().assertValue().equals(<js>"OK"</js>);
1081    *
1082    *    <jc>// Validates the response body contains the text "OK".</jc>
1083    *    <jv>client</jv>
1084    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1085    *       .run()
1086    *       .getContent().assertValue().contains(<js>"OK"</js>);
1087    *
1088    *    <jc>// Validates the response body passes a predicate test.</jc>
1089    *    <jv>client</jv>
1090    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1091    *       .run()
1092    *       .getContent().assertValue().is(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv>.contains(<js>"OK"</js>));
1093    *
1094    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression.</jc>
1095    *    <jv>client</jv>
1096    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1097    *       .run()
1098    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1099    *
1100    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression using regex flags.</jc>
1101    *    <jv>client</jv>
1102    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1103    *       .run()
1104    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>,  <jsf>MULTILINE</jsf> &amp; <jsf>CASE_INSENSITIVE</jsf>);
1105    *
1106    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression in the form of an existing Pattern.</jc>
1107    *    Pattern <jv>pattern</jv> = Pattern.<jsm>compile</jsm>(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1108    *    <jv>client</jv>
1109    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1110    *       .run()
1111    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<jv>pattern</jv>);
1112    * </p>
1113    *
1114    * <p>
1115    * The assertion test returns the original response object allowing you to chain multiple requests like so:
1116    * <p class='bjava'>
1117    *    <jc>// Validates the response body matches a regular expression.</jc>
1118    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>client</jv>
1119    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1120    *       .run()
1121    *       .getContent().assertValue().isPattern(<js>".*OK.*"</js>);
1122    *       .getContent().assertValue().isNotPattern(<js>".*ERROR.*"</js>)
1123    *       .getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1124    * </p>
1125    *
1126    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1127    *    <li class='note'>
1128    *       If no charset was found on the <code>Content-Type</code> response header, <js>"UTF-8"</js> is assumed.
1129    *  <li class='note'>
1130    *    This method automatically calls {@link #cache()} so that the body can be retrieved multiple times.
1131    *    <li class='note'>
1132    *       The input stream is automatically closed after this call.
1133    * </ul>
1134    *
1135    * @return A new fluent assertion object.
1136    */
1137   public FluentResponseBodyAssertion<ResponseContent> assertValue() {
1138      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this);
1139   }
1140
1141   /**
1142    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().asString()</c>.
1143    *
1144    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1145    */
1146   public FluentStringAssertion<ResponseContent> assertString() {
1147      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).asString();
1148   }
1149
1150   /**
1151    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().asBytes()</c>.
1152    *
1153    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1154    */
1155   public FluentByteArrayAssertion<ResponseContent> assertBytes() {
1156      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).asBytes();
1157   }
1158
1159   /**
1160    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().as(<jv>type</jv>)</c>.
1161    *
1162    * @param <T> The object type to create.
1163    * @param type The object type to create.
1164    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1165    */
1166   public <T> FluentAnyAssertion<T,ResponseContent> assertObject(Class<T> type) {
1167      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).as(type);
1168   }
1169
1170   /**
1171    * Shortcut for calling <c>assertValue().as(<jv>type</jv>, <jv>args</jv>)</c>.
1172    *
1173    * @param <T> The object type to create.
1174    * @param type The object type to create.
1175    * @param args Optional type arguments.
1176    * @return A new fluent assertion.
1177    */
1178   public <T> FluentAnyAssertion<Object,ResponseContent> assertObject(Type type, Type...args) {
1179      return new FluentResponseBodyAssertion<>(this, this).as(type, args);
1180   }
1181
1182   /**
1183    * Returns the response that created this object.
1184    *
1185    * @return The response that created this object.
1186    */
1187   public RestResponse response() {
1188      return response;
1189   }
1190
1191   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1192   // HttpEntity passthrough methods.
1193   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1194
1195   /**
1196    * Tells if the entity is capable of producing its data more than once.
1197    *
1198    * <p>
1199    * A repeatable entity's {@link #getContent()} and {@link #writeTo(OutputStream)} methods can be called more than
1200    * once whereas a non-repeatable entity's can not.
1201    *
1202    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1203    * <li class='note'>This method always returns <jk>true</jk> if the response body is cached (see {@link #cache()}).
1204    * </ul>
1205    *
1206    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entity is repeatable, <jk>false</jk> otherwise.
1207    */
1208   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1209   public boolean isRepeatable() {
1210      return cached || entity.isRepeatable();
1211   }
1212
1213   /**
1214    * Tells about chunked encoding for this entity.
1215    *
1216    * <p>
1217    * The primary purpose of this method is to indicate whether chunked encoding should be used when the entity is sent.
1218    * <br>For entities that are received, it can also indicate whether the entity was received with chunked encoding.
1219    *
1220    * <p>
1221    * The behavior of wrapping entities is implementation dependent, but should respect the primary purpose.
1222    *
1223    * @return <jk>true</jk> if chunked encoding is preferred for this entity, or <jk>false</jk> if it is not.
1224    */
1225   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1226   public boolean isChunked() {
1227      return entity.isChunked();
1228   }
1229
1230   /**
1231    * Tells the length of the content, if known.
1232    *
1233    * @return
1234    *    The number of bytes of the content, or a negative number if unknown.
1235    *    <br>If the content length is known but exceeds {@link Long#MAX_VALUE}, a negative number is returned.
1236    */
1237   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1238   public long getContentLength() {
1239      return body != null ? body.length : entity.getContentLength();
1240   }
1241
1242   /**
1243    * Obtains the <c>Content-Type</c> header, if known.
1244    *
1245    * <p>
1246    * This is the header that should be used when sending the entity, or the one that was received with the entity.
1247    * It can include a charset attribute.
1248    *
1249    * @return The <c>Content-Type</c> header for this entity, or <jk>null</jk> if the content type is unknown.
1250    */
1251   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1252   public ResponseHeader getContentType() {
1253      return new ResponseHeader("Content-Type", request, response, entity.getContentType());
1254   }
1255
1256   /**
1257    * Obtains the Content-Encoding header, if known.
1258    *
1259    * <p>
1260    * This is the header that should be used when sending the entity, or the one that was received with the entity.
1261    * <br>Wrapping entities that modify the content encoding should adjust this header accordingly.
1262    *
1263    * @return The <c>Content-Encoding</c> header for this entity, or <jk>null</jk> if the content encoding is unknown.
1264    */
1265   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1266   public ResponseHeader getContentEncoding() {
1267      return new ResponseHeader("Content-Encoding", request, response, entity.getContentEncoding());
1268   }
1269
1270   /**
1271    * Returns a content stream of the entity.
1272    *
1273    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1274    *    <li class='note'>This method is equivalent to {@link #asInputStream()} which is the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
1275    *    <li class='note'>This input stream will auto-close once the end of stream has been reached.
1276    *    <li class='note'>It is up to the caller to properly close this stream if not fully consumed.
1277    *    <li class='note'>This method can be called multiple times if the entity is repeatable or the cache flag is set on this object.
1278    *    <li class='note'>Calling this method multiple times on a non-repeatable or cached body will throw a {@link IllegalStateException}.
1279    *       Note that this is different from the HttpClient specs for this method.
1280    * </ul>
1281    *
1282    * @return Content stream of the entity.
1283    */
1284   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1285   public InputStream getContent() throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
1286      return asInputStream();
1287   }
1288
1289   /**
1290    * Writes the entity content out to the output stream.
1291    *
1292    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1293    *    <li class='note'>This method is equivalent to {@link #pipeTo(OutputStream)} which is the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
1294    * </ul>
1295    *
1296    * @param outstream The output stream to write entity content to.
1297    */
1298   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1299   public void writeTo(OutputStream outstream) throws IOException {
1300      pipeTo(outstream);
1301   }
1302
1303   /**
1304    * Tells whether this entity depends on an underlying stream.
1305    *
1306    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1307    * <li class='note'>This method always returns <jk>false</jk> if the response body is cached (see {@link #cache()}.
1308    * </ul>
1309    *
1310    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the entity content is streamed, <jk>false</jk> otherwise.
1311    */
1312   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1313   public boolean isStreaming() {
1314      return cached ? false : entity.isStreaming();
1315   }
1316
1317   /**
1318    * This method is called to indicate that the content of this entity is no longer required.
1319    *
1320    * <p>
1321    * This method is of particular importance for entities being received from a connection.
1322    * <br>The entity needs to be consumed completely in order to re-use the connection with keep-alive.
1323    *
1324    * @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs.
1325    * @deprecated Use standard java convention to ensure resource deallocation by calling {@link InputStream#close()} on
1326    * the input stream returned by {@link #getContent()}
1327    */
1328   @Override /* HttpEntity */
1329   @Deprecated
1330   public void consumeContent() throws IOException {
1331      entity.consumeContent();
1332   }
1333
1334   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1335   // Utility methods
1336   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1337
1338   private BeanContext getBeanContext() {
1339      return parser == null ? BeanContext.DEFAULT : parser.getBeanContext();
1340   }
1341
1342   private <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> c) {
1343      return getBeanContext().getClassMeta(c);
1344   }
1345
1346   private <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Type type, Type...args) {
1347      return getBeanContext().getClassMeta(type, args);
1348   }
1349
1350   @Override
1351   public String toString() {
1352      try {
1353         return asString();
1354      } catch (RestCallException e) {
1355         return e.getLocalizedMessage();
1356      }
1357   }
1358}
